skills.DESCRIPTION: Observe and describe physical properties of everyday materials including texture, weight, hardness, and flexibility.
Group objects based on observable physical properties and explain reasoning for classifications.
Recognize that materials can exist as solids and liquids, and observe how they can change between states.
Explore how objects move when different forces (pushing/pulling) are applied to them.
Investigate how different objects make sound through vibration and identify varying pitch and volume.
Explore how light interacts with different materials to create shadows and reflections.
Discover how simple tools and machines like ramps, wheels, and levers help make work easier.
